content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here's a function called `extract_julia_code` in Julia:

```julia
using Markdown

function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    blocks = Markdown.parse(md)
    code_blocks = filter(b -> typeof(b) == Markdown.Code, blocks)
    codes = join([replace(str, "`" => "") for str in map(Markdown.plaintext, code_blocks)], "\n")
end
```
This function uses the `Markdown` package in Julia to parse the markdown document into a list of blocks (elements of the parsed markdown). It then filters out all elements that are not code blocks, and then joins these together with newline characters. The code inside each block is stripped of any fences using the replace function.

Please note that you should have the `Markdown` package installed in your Julia environment to use this function. You can install it via the Pkg REPL-mode with `]add Markdown`.
